channel.title: The Laravel Podcast
channel.description: The Laravel Podcast brings you Laravel and PHP development news and discussion. The podcast is hosted by Matt Stauffer and regular guests include Taylor Otwell (the creator of Laravel) and Jeffrey Way (the creator of Laracasts).
channel.itunes:author: Taylor Otwell
channel.itunes:summary: The Laravel Podcast brings you Laravel and PHP development news and discussion. The podcast is hosted by Matt Stauffer and regular guests include Taylor Otwell (the creator of Laravel) and Jeffrey Way (the creator of Laracasts).
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Laravel Podcast brings you Laravel and PHP development news and discussion.

item.title: Episode 52: Doug Pro
item.description: In this episode, the crew talks about Mix, Dusk, Laracon US, package development using TestBench, GitLab, and more.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode, the crew talks about Mix, Dusk, Laracon US, package development using TestBench, GitLab, and more.

  • Gitlab.com Database Incident
  • Laravel from Scratch
  • Laracon
  • Orchestra Testbench

item.title: Episode 20 - The War on CRUD
item.description: We talk about configuration and queue updates, architecture and CRUD apps, clients and code quality, business and app development, and a lot more.
item.content:encoded:
We talk about configuration and queue updates, architecture and CRUD apps, choosing the right persistence solution, and a lot more.

Watch the original Live Video Recording
item.author: taylor@laravel.com (Shawn McCool, Taylor Otwell, and Jeffrey Way)

item.title: Episode 19 - Live Q&A
item.description: This is the audio portion of our first live recorded video podcast. We took live question and answer and discussed Laravel 5 release scheduling, ORM origin story, Laravel internals, Angular/Angular 2, and more!
item.content:encoded:
This is the audio portion of our first live recorded video podcast. We took live question and answer and discussed Laravel 5 release scheduling, ORM origin story, Laravel internals, Angular/Angular 2, and more!

Watch the original Live Video Recording
item.author: taylor@laravel.com (Shawn McCool, Taylor Otwell, Jeffrey Way)
item.itunes:author: Shawn McCool, Taylor Otwell, Jeffrey Way
item.itunes:summary: This is the audio portion of our first live recorded video podcast. We took live question and answer and discussed Laravel 5 release scheduling, ORM origin story, Laravel internals, Angular/Angular 2, and more!
item.itunes:subtitle: This is the audio portion of our first live recorded video podcast. We took live question and answer and discussed Laravel 5 release scheduling, ORM origin story, Laravel internals, Angular/Angular 2, and more!

item.title: Episode 18 - The War over PHP Annotations
item.description: In this episode, we discuss new Laravel 5 features including annotated routing and middlewares. We discuss some motivations and guiding forces that make Laravel what it is. Also, hints about Jeffrey and Taylor's secret new project. The referenced article by @everzet can be found here: http://everzet.com/post/99045129766/introducing-modelling-by-example
item.content:encoded: In this episode, we discuss new Laravel 5 features including annotated routing and middlewares. We discuss some motivations and guiding forces that make Laravel what it is. item.title: Episode 17 - Laravel 4.3.. I mean.. Laravel 5!
item.description: In this episode, we discuss Laravel 5, the No Capes initiative, Laravel Liferaft, PHP's position in the industry and its culture, continuous education, a company's ethical responsibility to their employees, and much more.
item.content:encoded: In this episode, we discuss Laravel 5, the No Capes initiative, Laravel Liferaft, PHP's position in the industry and its culture, continuous education, a company's ethical responsibility to their employees, and much more.

item.title: Episode 15 - DHH and Haterade
item.description: In this episode the cast discusses ActiveRecord (when to use it), discusses some PHP drama relating Laravel to Rails, DHH, Martin Fowler, and Kent Beck's Is TDD dead? series, Laracon stuff and more. http://laracon.eu http://martinfowler.com/articles/is-tdd-dead https://github.com/mitchellvanw/laravel-doctrine

item.title: Episode 13 - Cute Tools
item.description: Testing, 100% minimum coverage, TDD. The consequences of long-term high-intensity focus. What does PHPSpec have to offer? The battle over Trait / Interface suffixes. Imposter Syndrome. Links to other Podcasts mentioned in this episode. http://www.thisamericanlife.org/ http://freakonomics.com/radio/ http://www.radiolab.org/ and just one extra added for relevance: elephantintheroom.io

item.title: Episode 12 - PHP isn't Java?
item.description: Everyone on the show is presenting at Laracon NYC. http://www.decksetapp.com/ for beautiful presentations What do people most misunderstand about Laravel? PHP is not Java? PHPStorm. It's good. So is Jetbrains. Here's a theme that makes it better(tm). https://github.com/ShawnMcCool/PHPStorm-SpacePeacock Taylor's Conspiracy Theories Twitter, it's not just for sharing your lunch. Open-Source.. Does it make sense? Database Backup Package https://github.com/heybigname/backup-manager Flysystem http://flysystem.thephpleague.com The Economics of Open-Source. Laracon EU and SURVEY SAYS. Vaprobash. Laravel.io's next version.
item.content:encoded: Everyone on the show is presenting at Laracon NYC. http://www.decksetapp.com/ for beautiful presentations What do people most misunderstand about Laravel? PHP is not Java? item.title: Episode 11 - A/B Testing and Niel Patrick Harris
item.description: Is this episode the cast discusses Laracon NYC, Laracon EU, the Laravel package Dispatcher, Hack, DDD, A/B Testing, the next version of Laravel.IO, Niel Patrick Harris, and PHPStorm for Sublime Text users. Hosted by Shawn McCool. Edited by Mitchell van Wijngaarden.

item.title: Episode 8 - LaraEverything
item.description: Taylor Otwell and Jeffrey Way join us and talk about what they've been working on. We discuss Laracasts and Laravel 4.1 including some focus on the Laravel documentation. Taylor also gives some information about LaraconUS.

item.title: Episode 1 - Hello World
item.description: In this first episode we're joined by Taylor Otwell, the creator of Laravel to discuss Laravel 4, and Shawn McCool to discuss Laracon EU taking place in August, 2013. Enjoy!
